_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!
Mother Nature once again reminds us of her unpredictable nature. Following yesterday’s significant rainfall, a thin layer of ice covers the mountain this morning, and our teams are hard at work preparing the slopes.

Good news: the North and South sides will be open this morning for first tracks — a first this season! First tracks will be accessible from the Duncan, Gondola, Lowell-Thomas, and Soleil lifts. As the morning progresses and conditions continue to improve, additional trails will open, including those on the Soleil side. Both terrain parks and the Porte du Soleil lift will also open as conditions allow.

Winds are strong this morning, so please dress warmly and exercise extra caution on the trails due to variable conditions.

Be sure to check this webpage regularly for the latest updates.
We look forward to seeing you at the summit!

Mountain safety tip of the week: KNOW THE ZONE. On the slopes, leave enough space to avoid collisions. Control your speed and direction to maintain a safe distance from others, in case they suddenly change direction.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This Saturday morning, Mother Nature remains unpredictable. After yesterday’s heavy rainfall, a thin layer of ice covers the mountain this morning. However, we do have some good news: the North and South sides are open this morning for first tracks! Some trails, including those on the Soleil side, both terrain parks, and the Porte du Soleil lift will open gradually. Strong winds—dress warmly.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: En ce samedi matin, dame Nature demeure imprévisible. Après les fortes pluies d’hier, une fine couche de glace recouvre la montagne ce matin. Par contre, nous avons tout de même une bonne nouvelle: les versants Nord et Sud ouvrent dès ce matin pour les premières traces! Certaines pistes, dont celles du versant Soleil, les deux parcs et la remontée Porte du Soleil ouvriront graduellement. Vents forts: habillez-vous chaudement.
